entry.title: Add ICQ support to BeejiveIM
entry.content:
There’s an easy way to restore “ICQ support” inside BeejiveIM by fooling the application ;)

Note: This trick works on jailbroken devices only!

  1. Install BeejiveIM and launch it a first time on your iDevice, then, and this is important, quit the application completely (–> remove it from the multitasking bar on your iDevice!)
  2. Download this file to your computer
  3. Open the file with a text editor (e.g. TextWrangler for Mac), find the phrase “Your_ICQ_Number_Here“, delete this text and enter your ICQ number. Don’t forget to save the changes.
  4. Now, we have to copy the file to its destination path. Use iExplorer or PhoneView to browse the Applications on your iDevice and enter the BeejiveIM folder. Then copy the file you’ve edited to the “Documents” folder by overwriting the existing one.
  5. You’re done. Launch BeejiveIM, click on your ICQ number and type in your password.
  6. Enjoy :)

entry.title: Repair Cydia
entry.content:
Today I friend of mine told me that his Cydia would not work anymore. It did not even start up, so we had to fix it remotely. Luckily, he had openSSH installed on his phone...

Attention: Only download packages that end in "iphoneos-arm.deb"

  1. Go to http://apt.saurik.com/debs/ and keep it open
  2. Download the latest versions of berkeleydb, curl, apt7-key, apt7-ssl, apt7-lib and apt7
  3. Use an SCP client to push all those deb files from your computer to the iPhone
  4. Log into your iPhone via SSH
  5. Install each package with dpkg -i package.deb, replacing package with the file name (you will need to install the packages in the same order I listed them)
  6. Once you have successfully installed all packages, you can use this command: apt-get install –fix-broken which will fix all your broken packages.
  7. Now Cydia should work again
